description: man with sideburns wearing dark-rimmed glasses, white apron, and white shirt, frying doughnuts
markings: verso stamped in black: © BILL OWENS / EXTRA BOOK PRINT
title: I gross over $200,000 a year as the owner-manager of a donut store, but there's a price to pay. I come to work at 2:00 A.M. to begin the daily routine of making 250 dozen donuts. I eat dinner at 4:00 in the afternoon and am in bed by 7:30. I was a Depression baby. Now kids say there has to be something better.
